products: YourCareCommunity Patient Portal with YourCareEverywhere App

access.description: The registered URL returns HTTP 200 directly with no redirects. It's a WordPress page on WP Engine behind Cloudflare. The EHI Export section is embedded in a marketing-style interoperability page — you must scroll down past several feature sections to reach the 'EHI Export' heading (anchor id='EHIExport'). No accordion or click-to-expand needed. The section contains a brief description and a single link to an XLSX file with FHIR extension field documentation. The page uses WP Rocket lazy-loading JavaScript, but the EHI content is present in the HTML source and accessible via curl.

product_context.description: MEDHOST is a healthcare IT company serving hospitals and healthcare facilities, with particular strength in the emergency department and community/rural hospital market. The product suite is a full hospital EHR platform with multiple certified modules: MEDHOST EDIS (Emergency Department Information System), MEDHOST Enterprise Clinicals (hospital EHR clinical documentation), MEDHOST Enterprise Financials (revenue cycle, accounts payable, general ledger, materials management), YourCareCommunity Patient Portal (patient-facing portal with health record access and fitness data integration), and YourCareCommunity Provider Portal. The Enterprise EHR includes clinical suites (clinician, physician, perioperative, anesthesia, pharmacy), scheduling, document management (DMS), and public health reporting. The EDIS product is a specialized ED system with touch-screen charting, order entry, charge capture, triage, and barcode medication scanning. The financial suite includes accounts payable, general ledger, materials management, credit card processing, and corporate reporting. The patient portal supports health info exchange and integration with wearable devices (Fitbit, Garmin). This is a comprehensive hospital IT platform — the EHI export should cover data from all these modules.
product_context.certified_module_name: MEDHOST EDIS / MEDHOST Enterprise - Clinicals / MEDHOST Enterprise - Financials / YourCareCommunity Portals

export_approach.description: MEDHOST uses FHIR R4 v4.0.1 as the structure for EHI export. The export generates multiple NDJSON files per patient, packaged as a compressed ZIP file. Two export types are supported: single-patient (initiated by patient via YourCare portal or by facility administrator) and system-wide (administrator-only). MEDHOST extends standard FHIR R4 resources with additional fields to accommodate data captured in MEDHOST that is not defined in FHIR R4 — these extensions are documented in an XLSX file. The export is FHIR-based but goes beyond standard FHIR by adding 713 extension fields across 41 resource types. This hybrid approach means the export benefits from FHIR's structure while carrying additional vendor-specific data. However, it still inherits FHIR R4's structural limitations — FHIR R4 does not have well-defined resources for billing line items with dollar amounts, insurance claim adjudication details, portal messages, or audit trails.

documentation_quality.description: The documentation is minimal. The EHI export section on the interoperability page is a single paragraph with a link to an XLSX file. The XLSX file (last modified December 2022) documents only MEDHOST's FHIR extension fields — the fields that go beyond standard FHIR R4. It does NOT document the standard FHIR R4 fields included in each resource; a reader must cross-reference the HL7 FHIR R4 specification for those. Each extension field has a name, version, FHIR type, max length, description, and internal database table/column references (labeled 'internal use only') for both Enterprise and EDIS systems. The internal DB column references are extremely valuable — they show exactly which database tables the data comes from (e.g., 'BILMST50.SUM(CGDAMT)' for appointment charges). There are no sample NDJSON files, no enumerated list of which FHIR resource types are included in the export, and no documentation of the ZIP file structure. The Directions sheet shows how extension URLs are formatted. The documentation version appears to be '2022r1'.

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: MEDHOST's FHIR-based export with extensions covers clinical data comprehensively and includes notable non-clinical categories that many FHIR-based exports miss — particularly insurance/coverage with authorization details and dollar amounts, appointment scheduling with charges, and charge items with CPT codes. The 713 extension fields show genuine effort to go beyond standard FHIR R4. However, there are significant gaps. The product includes a patient portal (YourCareCommunity) and a full financial suite (Enterprise - Financials with AP, GL, materials management), but the export documentation shows no evidence of portal messaging, no claims/payments data (only charge items), and no audit trails. The Encounter resource has 102 extension fields including financial class, deposit amounts, and charge amounts — suggesting deep encounter-level data. The Coverage resource has 30 extension fields including authorization details (numbers, periods, approved/denied days, reasons). This is a better-than-average FHIR-based export, but the absence of messaging, claims adjudication, and audit data is notable for a platform with five certified products.

clinical.evidence: Extensive clinical coverage across 41 FHIR resource types: AllergyIntolerance (with pharmacy-reviewed flag), Condition (with DSM codes, CC/MCC indicators), Condition-Past Medical History, CarePlan (Discharge Plan), Consent, DetectedIssue, DiagnosticReport (with specimen source, collected-by), Encounter (102 extensions including nursing station, diet, admission details), FamilyMemberHistory, Goal (with completion tracking), Immunization (27 extensions including NDC, series), ImplantableDevice (40 extensions), MedicationAdministration (with late-admin reasons, PRN reasons), MedicationRequest for discharge meds/inpatient meds/prescriptions, MedicationStatement (home meds), multiple Observation types (labs with 44 extensions, alcohol/drug use, education, marital status, occupation, sexual behavior, travel), Patient (59 extensions including SSN, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, organ donor, dietary preferences), Procedure (103 extensions including blood loss, billing sequence), Problem, SmokingStatus, QuestionAnswer, RelatedPerson (30 extensions), ServiceRequest (PC Orders with vital signs), Practitioner, Location, MDRO.

secure_messages.evidence: Searched all 41 resource sheets for 'message', 'inbox', 'communication', 'chat', 'portal', 'secure' — only hits were MedicationRequest-Prescriptions with 'message-type' and 'message-id' fields related to e-prescribing messages, not patient-provider communication. No Communication, MessageHeader, or similar messaging resource is included. The product includes YourCareCommunity Patient Portal (a separately certified product) which would store patient-provider communications, but this data appears absent from the export.

billing_financial.evidence: ChargeItem resource with 20 extension fields including primary/secondary/tertiary insurance CPT codes and modifiers. Appointment resource includes 'charges' field (patient charges from BILMST50.SUM(CGDAMT)). Encounter resource includes 'deposit-amount', 'charge-amount', and 'financial-class'. Ancillary Order includes billing G-codes, billing modifiers, billing system name, billing result text, and charge type. Procedure includes billing-sequence-number. However, this is charge capture only — there are no resources for claims submission, payment posting, remittance advice, AR management, accounts payable, or general ledger entries, despite MEDHOST Enterprise - Financials being a separately certified product that includes these capabilities.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Coverage resource with 30 extension fields is notably detailed: authorization number, authorization period, authorization modified user/date, approved/denied days, denied reason, authorization notes, co-insurance days/amounts, lifetime reserve days/amounts, units of blood, percent covered charges (parts 1 and 2), maximum amounts, room coverage percentages, payment percent, contract number, 90-day indicator. Encounter resource also includes insurance-related fields (insurance, insurance-limit1, insurance-limit2). This is one of the stronger insurance/coverage implementations among FHIR-based exports.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Appointment resource with 21 extension fields including charges, reschedule details (requested by, comment, reason), deleted date, procedure codes/descriptions, charge codes/descriptions, procedure type codes, and appointment question/answer data. This goes beyond basic scheduling to include financial and Q&A data associated with appointments.

documents_images.evidence: No DocumentReference, Binary, or similar resource for documents/images found in the XLSX file. The product includes a Document Management System (DMS) as part of Enterprise Financials and mentions document scanning capabilities, but no document/image export is documented. DiagnosticReport is present but only covers lab results with specimen data, not scanned documents or images.

audit_trails.evidence: No AuditEvent or dedicated audit resource is included. However, many individual resources contain audit-related extension fields that reference internal audit tables: modify-reason and modify-comment fields reference tables like PL_SOCIAL_HIST_DETAIL_AUDIT, PL_SOCIAL_HIST_HEADER_AUDIT, clim_immunity_evidence_audit, pvcr_acknowledge_audit. These provide field-level change tracking within individual resources but are not a comprehensive audit trail of who accessed records, when, and what they viewed.

issues: No secure messaging data is included despite the product having a separately certified patient portal (YourCareCommunity) that likely stores patient-provider communications.
No documents or images are included despite the product having a Document Management System (DMS) as part of Enterprise Financials.
No comprehensive audit trail resource is included, though some audit metadata is embedded in individual resource extensions.

The financial export covers charge capture (ChargeItem, billing codes) but not claims submission, payment posting, remittance, accounts receivable, accounts payable, or general ledger — major gaps given that MEDHOST Enterprise - Financials is a separately certified product.

Documentation is a single XLSX file last modified in December 2022, documenting only FHIR extension fields — not the complete export schema. Standard FHIR R4 base fields are not documented; readers must cross-reference the HL7 FHIR R4 specification.
No enumeration of which FHIR resource types are included in the export — this can only be inferred from the XLSX sheet names.
No sample export files, no documentation of the ZIP structure, and no documentation of the NDJSON file naming convention.
The XLSX file metadata predates current HTI-1 requirements (2022 vintage), raising questions about whether it reflects the current state of the export.

Five separately certified products (EDIS, Enterprise Clinicals, Enterprise Financials, Patient Portal, Provider Portal) but the export documentation appears to primarily cover clinical data from Enterprise Clinicals and EDIS, with limited financial data and no portal data.

downloaded_files.description: FHIR extension fields documentation — 45 sheets covering 41 FHIR resource types with 713 total extension fields. Documents MEDHOST-specific fields beyond standard FHIR R4, including field names, FHIR types, max lengths, descriptions, and internal database table/column references for both Enterprise and EDIS systems.
downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -L -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36' -o downloads/MEDHOST-FHIR-Extension-Fields.xlsx 'https://www.medhost.com/fhir/extensions/MEDHOST-FHIR-Extension-Fields.xlsx'

downloaded_files.description: Full HTML of the interoperability page containing the EHI Export section (anchor id='EHIExport') with description of single-patient and system export, FHIR R4 approach, and link to extension fields XLSX.

summary: MEDHOST exports EHI as FHIR R4 NDJSON files in a ZIP archive, with 713 vendor-specific extension fields across 41 resource types that go meaningfully beyond standard FHIR R4 — particularly for insurance coverage (30 extension fields with authorization details and dollar amounts), encounters (102 extensions with financial and administrative data), and charge items. However, the export has significant gaps given that MEDHOST has five separately certified products: secure messaging from the patient portal is absent, document/image data from the DMS is absent, comprehensive financial data (claims, payments, AR, AP, GL) from Enterprise Financials is missing despite charge capture being present, and there is no dedicated audit trail export. The documentation itself is minimal — a single 2022-vintage XLSX file documenting only FHIR extensions, with no sample files, no export structure docs, and no list of included resource types.
notes: The internal database column references in the XLSX file (labeled 'internal use only') are revealing: they show tables like BILMST50, PATHIST, RXPROFPP, OEORDER, MREROIR, CHPPROBP, etc. — indicating a substantial underlying database with far more data than what surfaces through the FHIR resource model. The 'Y database table/col' column in some sheets (Allergy, FamilyMemberHistory, Immunization, MedicationStatement-HomeMed) likely refers to the YourCareCommunity portal database, suggesting some portal data is mapped but limited to clinical records rather than messaging. The EDIS column is frequently 'N/A' for many fields, suggesting the EDIS emergency department system may have a more limited export compared to Enterprise Clinicals.
